glsa.title: Python 2.2: Buffer overflow in getaddrinfo()
glsa.synopsis: Python 2.2 has a vulnerability in DNS handling when IPV6 is disabled and a malformed IPV6 address is encountered by getaddrinfo().

background.p: Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented, cross-platform programming language.

description.p: If IPV6 is disabled in Python 2.2, getaddrinfo() is not able to handle IPV6 DNS requests properly and a buffer overflow occurs.

impact.p: An attacker can execute arbitrary code as the user running python.

workaround.p: Users with IPV6 enabled are not affected by this vulnerability.

resolution.p: All Python 2.2 users should upgrade to the latest version:
